poem:
"Upon the Stand of Truth"

The titan, his gravitas flutters illusory,
In the vaudeville of vanish'd Autonomy.
Yet the trial, oh ponderous dance,
Courthouse whispers paint fraud's romance.
Not perfect, he sighs in paneled halls,
Where verdict of silence oft befalls.
Never simple, the tangled web of power,
In this twilight hour of reckoning's bower.
